oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: State Guard at Vultee Aircraft Factory
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Military staff of the 2nd Regiment with their leader, Brigadier General Jacob McGavock Dickinson.

Part of Governor Prentice Cooper's tireless drive to mobilize the state for World War II involved developing and overseeing the state's war industries. The intial airplane factory located along Briley Parkway and adjacent to Berry Field was built in the late 1930s. Voltee Aircraft purchased the facility in 1940 and became the first defense plant in the area, employing a large number of women during the war.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tennessee State Guard, 1941-1946
